item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>Mike,</p><p>I don't have a ND6 client installed these days so can only apologise for not being specific on the version. Thanks for pointing it out.</p><p>Roll on the appearance of the Hannover Designer client!</p><p>Matt</p>
item.content:encoded:
Mike,

I don’t have a ND6 client installed these days so can only apologise for not being specific on the version. Thanks for pointing it out.

Roll on the appearance of the Hannover Designer client!

Matt

item.title: By: Mike Miller
item.dc:creator: Mike Miller
item.description: <p>Matt,<br/>I am very new to Java and am in the middle of writing a web service consuming agent. One important thing I've learned is to pay close attention to the version of Notes/Domino (I'm currently at 6.5.4) as well as the corresponding JVM version.</p><p>I noticed your reference to websvc.jar and found that my 6.5.4 installation doesn't have it. Must be a R7 item?</p><p>Anyway, the agent I'm currently working on only requires java.io.*, java.net.*, java.util.*, lotus.domino.*, org.w3c.dom.*</p><p>One thing is for sure, if not for Eclipse, I would have given up and abandoned any hope of ever developing anything in Java. Eclipse is AWESOME and Domiclipse (as soon as I master all its subtleties) makes it even better.</p>
item.content:encoded:
Matt,
I am very new to Java and am in the middle of writing a web service consuming agent. One important thing I’ve learned is to pay close attention to the version of Notes/Domino (I’m currently at 6.5.4) as well as the corresponding JVM version.

I noticed your reference to websvc.jar and found that my 6.5.4 installation doesn’t have it. Must be a R7 item?

Anyway, the agent I’m currently working on only requires java.io.*, java.net.*, java.util.*, lotus.domino.*, org.w3c.dom.*

One thing is for sure, if not for Eclipse, I would have given up and abandoned any hope of ever developing anything in Java. Eclipse is AWESOME and Domiclipse (as soon as I master all its subtleties) makes it even better.
